intro: Pelargonium atrum, commonly known as the dark-leaved geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. Pelargonium atrum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
